segment.source: Install VAMT (Windows 10)
segment.target: Install VAMT (Windows 10)

segment.source: Install VAMT
segment.target: Install VAMT

segment.source: Install VAMT
segment.target: Install VAMT

segment.source: This topic describes how to install the Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT).
segment.target: This topic describes how to install the Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT).

segment.source: Install VAMT
segment.target: Install VAMT

segment.source: You can install VAMT as part of the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (ADK) for Windows 10.
segment.target: You can install VAMT as part of the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (ADK) for Windows 10.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: VAMT requires local administrator privileges on all managed computers in order to deposit confirmation IDs (CIDs), get the client products’ license status, and install product keys.
segment.target: VAMT requires local administrator privileges on all managed computers in order to deposit confirmation IDs (CIDs), get the client products’ license status, and install product keys.

segment.source: If VAMT is being used to manage products and product keys on the local host computer and you do not have administrator privileges, start VAMT with elevated privileges.
segment.target: If VAMT is being used to manage products and product keys on the local host computer and you do not have administrator privileges, start VAMT with elevated privileges.

segment.source: For Active Directory-Based Activation use, for best results we recommend running VAMT while logged on as a domain administrator.
segment.target: For Active Directory-Based Activation use, for best results we recommend running VAMT while logged on as a domain administrator.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The VAMT Microsoft Management Console snap-in ships as an x86 package.
segment.target: The VAMT Microsoft Management Console snap-in ships as an x86 package.

segment.source: After you install VAMT, if you have a computer information list (CIL) that was created in a previous version of VAMT, you must import the list into a SQL database.
segment.target: After you install VAMT, if you have a computer information list (CIL) that was created in a previous version of VAMT, you must import the list into a SQL database.

segment.source: If you do not have SQL installed, you can download a free copy of Microsoft SQL Server Express and create a new database into which you can import the CIL.
segment.target: If you do not have SQL installed, you can download a free copy of Microsoft SQL Server Express and create a new database into which you can import the CIL.

segment.source: To install SQL Server Express:
segment.target: To install SQL Server Express:

segment.source: Install the Windows ADK.
segment.target: Install the Windows ADK.

segment.source: Ensure that Volume Activation Management Tool and Microsoft® SQL Server® 2012 Express are selected to be installed.
segment.target: Ensure that Volume Activation Management Tool and Microsoft® SQL Server® 2012 Express are selected to be installed.

segment.source: Click Install.
segment.target: Click Install.

segment.source: Select a Database
segment.target: Select a Database

segment.source: Using a SQL database installed during ADK setup If SQL Server 2012 Express was installed during ADK setup, the default database name will be ADK.By default, VAMT is configure to use a SQL database that is installed on the local machine during ADK setup and displays the server name as .ADK.
segment.target: Using a SQL database installed during ADK setup If SQL Server 2012 Express was installed during ADK setup, the default database name will be ADK.By default, VAMT is configure to use a SQL database that is installed on the local machine during ADK setup and displays the server name as .ADK.

segment.source: If the SQL database was installed on another machine, you must configure the database to allow remote connections and you must provide the corresponding server name.
segment.target: If the SQL database was installed on another machine, you must configure the database to allow remote connections and you must provide the corresponding server name.

segment.source: If a new VAMT database needs to be created, provide a name for the new database.
segment.target: If a new VAMT database needs to be created, provide a name for the new database.

segment.source: Using a SQL database installed outside of ADK setup
segment.target: Using a SQL database installed outside of ADK setup

segment.source: You must configure SQL installation to allow remote connections and you must provide the corresponding server name in the format: Machine NameSQL Server Name.
segment.target: You must configure SQL installation to allow remote connections and you must provide the corresponding server name in the format: Machine NameSQL Server Name.

segment.source: If a new VAMT database needs to be created, provide a name for the new database.
segment.target: If a new VAMT database needs to be created, provide a name for the new database.

segment.source: Uninstall VAMT
segment.target: Uninstall VAMT

segment.source: To uninstall VAMT via the Programs and Features Control Panel:
segment.target: To uninstall VAMT via the Programs and Features Control Panel:

segment.source: Open the Control Panel and select Programs and Features.
segment.target: Open the Control Panel and select Programs and Features.

segment.source: Select Assessment and Deployment Kit from the list of installed programs and click Change.
segment.target: Select Assessment and Deployment Kit from the list of installed programs and click Change.

segment.source: Follow the instructions in the Windows ADK installer to remove VAMT.
segment.target: Follow the instructions in the Windows ADK installer to remove VAMT.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Install and Configure VAMT
